summary: This document appears to be a forwarded email chain from May 20, 2021, containing a complaint from an individual to FBI leadership about false arrests and attempted murder, along with prior responses from FBI Buffalo and MPD directing the complainant to other channels. The chain references external complaints about Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Mentioned together in the subject of a forwarded external email complaint.
Both are senior FBI officials addressed together in the complaint email.

events.title: Complaint Letters Sent
events.description: The complainant references sending thousands of letters, emails, and other documents on this date regarding false arrests and attempted murder.

keyFacts: An individual sent a complaint on May 20, 2021, to FBI Director Wray and Deputy Director Abbate regarding '9 false arrests and imprisonments' and 'attempted murder by the use of 11 drugs'.

The email chain includes prior responses from 'FBI Buffalo' and MPD Acting Chief Robert Contee, which direct the complainant to contact local authorities or other departments, indicating the complaint was being routed through official channels.
The subject line of a forwarded email references 'Jeffrey Epstein & Ghislaine Maxwell', linking this correspondence to the broader Epstein case.
The document shows a pattern of an individual attempting to report serious allegations to multiple high-level government and law enforcement agencies.
